sentences.sContent: She often works at the weekend.
If you wash your hair too often, it can get too dry.
sentences.sCn: 如果洗头过勤，头发会变得干枯。

sentences.sContent: How often do you see your parents?
Robin is a difficult child; you’ve said so yourself often enough (= a lot of times ).
sentences.sCn: 罗宾是个难管的孩子，你自己也常常这么说。

sentences.sContent: ...Bill often gets painful “flashbacks”，in which unwanted memories intrude into his consciousness...
...People with HSAM often have to make efforts to avoid focusing on the past...
...people with this rare condition often find their unusual ability burdensome...
...are often more research-oriented and lend themselves to take-home testing...
...Women want to be able to do it all volunteer for school parties or cook delicious meals，and so their answer to any request is often Yes...
...is often conducted in a way that makes children incurious children of educated and upper-middle-class parents turn out to be far more curious...
...Students who put off their work until the last moment often find the exams more difficult than they actually are...
...often depending on the subject and course difficulty...
...while women often avoid conflict or strive to be the peacemaker...
...That people often experience trouble sleeping in a different bed in unfamiliar surroundings is a phenomenon known as the first-night effect...

phrases.pCn: 最经常；很多时候；通常来说

trans.tranOther: if something happens often, it happens regularly or many times
